channel.title: No More Tears - M@cky88
channel.description:
Dropped a single called No More Tears. Let me know what you think!
https://soundcloud.com/wolfdivine/no-more-tears

item.title: No More Tears - M@cky88
item.dc:creator: ThoughtfulNoise
item.description:
MackyJ:

All my songs aren’t original and neither is the rest of the world’s.

You don’t like the song that’s fine but the fact that your making a big deal out of something that you even do yourself is crazy to me.

I do like it. (I’m not sure about the rolled kicks mid-way, as I don’t think they work in that context, but hey.) I think you’ve picked a cool track with a really cool groove.
I just think what you’ve done is quite shady and dishonest.

spoiler

 
There’s a world of difference between the ‘nothing is truly original’ position and what you’ve done.

Similarly, how I use samples and how you’ve used them here are very, very different.

 

I’m not trying to disrespect the supreme jubilees and I’m not trying to steal their work.

But you kinda are. You didn’t reference the original in the SC track name, description or your post here.
Instead, you chose to present something that is just large, unaltered sections of someone else’s record as your own, original creation, with a new track name.

I’d love to hear a track built up based on what you’ve got so far.
But, presenting what you’ve got as an original track? Really?

In its current form, what have you really added that listeners wouldn’t get from the original? A kick?What would you lose by naming it more honestly on SC?

 

But I’ll give you a heads up when I’m in prison for copyright infringement.

Of course, it’s unlikely that you’ll ever get called out about it outside of here or the comments on SC.

Sure, I probably didn’t need to come at you as hard as I have to make my point. I just think it’s creatively lazy – and we should all be trying a bit harder than that.

Read full topic

preach it macky

item.title: No More Tears - M@cky88
item.dc:creator: MackyJ
item.description:
All my songs aren’t original and neither is the rest of the world’s. You even said that you don’t put recognition for samples that you’ve used in your songs sometimes. It’s art man. I’m not trying to disrespect the supreme jubilees and I’m not trying to steal their work. I just had fun making it and I’m trying to express that. So whether you liked the track or not, I felt that I wanted to release it. I posted this on here for me, my friends, and anyone who listens. I don’t need legal advice on the “morality” of posting a track that is altered slightly. But I’ll give you a heads up when I’m in prison for copyright infringement.

Read full topic

item.title: No More Tears - M@cky88
item.dc:creator: ThoughtfulNoise
item.description:
Well, this is it. Legal issues aside, it can be cool to heavily base a new track on a cool or well known sample. Heck, hip-hop and rap was built on it.

You just need to do something substantial to make it stand alone as a new creation.

Read full topic

item.title: No More Tears - M@cky88
item.dc:creator: ThoughtfulNoise
item.description:
MackyJ:

I’m receiving no money for.

You know that doesn’t make it ok, right?

SC is publishing. Legally, it’s no different from putting it on Spotify.

Now, I understand it happens. Many tracks don’t clear samples — including some of my own.
The issue I have with what you’ve done, is actually that you’ve done so little. You’ve basically taken two sections from someone else’s track, looped them, laid some subtle kicks over the top that don’t really add or change anything significantly. …and presented it as an original creation.

MackyJ:

I’m just trying to make music for people to enjoy

Then maybe make some music, rather than copy it?

 
Fwiw, I’m not upset. I’m just trying to discourage it.

Tbh, I was quite excited when the track started. I was looking forward to it going somewhere, based on a great groove sample. I hit the Like button almost instantly.
But then it didn’t go anywhere. You didn’t make it your own. (I removed the Like.)

As a groove track it’s quite cool. If you renamed it to acknowledge it’s effectively an edit of the Jubilees track, that wouldn’t make it legal, but it would at least be more honest.

Read full topic

item.title: No More Tears - M@cky88
item.dc:creator: MackyJ
item.description:
Also honestly it’s SoundCloud and people do this all the time so it’s kinda crazy how you are really upset about a song that’s on SoundCloud that I’m receiving no money for. It’s art and I’m just making music for fun man. I thought sampling the song was cool and it felt good making it. I’m not here for clout and I’m definitely not here for money. I’m just trying to make music for people to enjoy

Read full topic

item.title: No More Tears - M@cky88
item.dc:creator: ThoughtfulNoise
item.description:
If he’s been releasing stuff like this for a while, that doesn’t make it better. It makes it worse.

I wouldn’t really call this a remix. He’s looping a couple of sections and laying some so subtle kicks over the top.

I’d say this is closer to an edit or possible a V.I.P.

Either way, a remix or an edit/V.I.P., if you were being honest and upfront, you’d typically present it like this…

Supreme Jubilees – It’ll All Be Over (M@cky88 Edit)

You certainly shouldn’t be presenting ‘remixes’ as completely original tracks.

Read full topic

item.title: No More Tears - M@cky88
item.dc:creator: lemonboy
item.description:
Gotta say, you have a point here but about that… Macky’s been doing this for a long time & copyright doesn’t get him this badly. He just uses these because he usually makes remixes of them (kinda) or not. But if that’s what it is, I’ll let it be.

Read full topic

item.title: No More Tears - M@cky88
item.dc:creator: ThoughtfulNoise
item.description:
You seem to have done so little to transform the original that I’m struggling to understand why you’d present it as something new.

You’ve looped a couple of passages and overlaid some very subtle drums. You haven’t really changed it from the original

I was waiting for you to change it up and turn it into something new, but you never did.
Even for sample-based lofi hip-hop, you need to do something more transformative than simply looping it and calling it your own.

Tbh, I’d see this as borderline plagiarism. Not cool.

You’ve picked a good track to sample. Would be better if you did something more transformative with it.

https://www.youtube.com/embed/OVlJCE2q4VU

Read full topic
